The project WPA V (‘Work placements abroad V‘) is a follow-up project to the projects WPA I – IV.
WPA started in 2011 and is applied and coordinated by the ‚Berufskolleg West der Stadt Essen‘, a vocational college in Essen in the German federal state of North Rhine Westphalia, Germany. The European partners are either vocational colleges or institutions working as mediating partners or companies situated in Finland, France, the Netherlands, Norway, Turkey or the UK.

WPA V focusses on mobilities of 
a) apprentices in initial dual vocational training on ISCED level 4 education in courses related to engineering, chemistry and security services 
b) students in initial vocational training on ISCED level 4 education in courses related to metal technology and engineering 
c) educational staff working in classes of education for refugees and migrants

All 45 students will be in their second year of training at the time of the mobility and realize a 3-weeks work placement in a company abroad in the field of metalwork and mechanical engineering, chemistry or security services. (FIN, UK, NO, TR, NL).
The teacher is team leader for classes of education for refugees and migrants. She will teach in the target language Dutch at a VET school in Rotterdam and get an insight into the transfer of the target group from vocational training into the labour market and into referring concepts of the involved institutions.

The main sustainable objectives of this project are 

A. for the institution Berufskolleg West and its network

• consolidation of its internationalization strategy thereby enhancing its competitiveness as a vocational college in the region
• encouraging the learning and working within a European network of companies and educational institutions and those in the labour market in order to strengthen the region as a business location and enhancing its competitiveness 
• effecting quality objectives in vocational training by implementing mobilities and its outcomes into curricula, school organization, quality management and in-company training
• quality development of work placements abroad with regard to the quality commitment in learning agreements and ECVET transparency instruments.

B. for educational staff
• development educational personnel’s competencies with regard to their teaching objectives and functions within the vocational college
• enhancing project management skills for team leading functions

C. for apprentices and students 
• sustainable development of social and personal skills or our students including flexibility, communications skills, team spirit and tolerance through vocational work experience within a different cultural context
• sustainable development of students’ technical skills by taking into consideration both the level of training and individual requirements and hereby increasing their opportunities on the labour market
• development the students’ language skills, primarily the knowledge of English as lingua franca.

The main sustainable objectives of this project are to continue previous work and to encourage the learning and working within a European context and by collaborating with companies and educational institutions within the region, i.e. consolidation of the internationalisation strategy of the Berufskolleg West and collaboration with training companies and the Chamber of Commerce and their complete integration into the implementation of mobilities also with regard to the quality commitment in learning agreements and ECVET transparency instruments.

The process will be performed in accordance with the new ‘quality frame and guidelines for vocational colleges for the implementation of learning mobilities and practical training abroad’, published by the Ministery of Education in North Rhine-Westphalia (MSW).
The objective of the Berufskolleg West is the certification of vocational colleges in accordance with the Circular of the MSW for ‘International co-operation in European Vocational Training’ from 03.04.2017 – 311–1.25.05. Both documents can be downloaded from www.berufsbildung.nrw.de/cms/bildungsganguebergreifende-themen/idb/.
 
In the long run WPA V contributes to the institutions’ reputation and impact within the region plus the students’ competitiveness on the European labour market.

The Vocational College of Information  Technology and Medical Device Technolgy is sending 142 learners from both dual as well fulltime courses to various European countries. Based on the legal framwork of the German Vocational Training Act they will be spending 2-3 month working in companies. This project is based on previous positive experiences with such trainings and reflects the growing demand to gain european experiences as expressed by both companies as well as students. By using the German version of the ECVET roadmap, which outlines the process of preparation, support, selection and guidance (incl. the description of learning outcomes) as also the validation and recognition processes the students will recieve an extensive support of their language abilities, knowledge, skills and personal competences. Theses training periods abroad are supported by a cooperation between participating agencies, schools and companies to enrich the transfer of knowledge as well as enhancing the didactics and methods of teaching. We have therefore included a selected group of  particpating teachers from our college to support this aim.
Most participants are mainly based in the IT-professions while others study for degrees in medical devices technology. They are exspected to have passed their second year of training. Then they are selected by means of internal assessments, own applications and some are obliged to go as part of their regular training courses. We provide assistance in the area of language acquisition, introduce cultural and historical aspects of their host country and raise their awareness of intercultural differences. By this we want to provide a sound preparation for the upcoming trainings as well the european labor market. Through an early cooperation between German companies, our institution, our partners and companies abroad we want to safeguard a good placement which responds to the needs and competenes of our students. The students should be fully able to practice and apply their skills and competences. Our partner institutions abroad  are providing the neccessary organisational framework in accordance with our own and mutually agreed standards of quality management. The OSZ IMT is in charge of the overall planning, organisation and finally does the evaluation and public presentation of the outcomes of this project. We exspect that participating in this programme will increase the motivation and ability to join European workplaces and the common labor market, it will also broaden the professional as well as personal perspectives and lead to more social empathy and tolerance.
proDISCO IV - Discover Your Key Qualifications in Europe

The project "ProDISCO - Discover Your Key Qualifications in Europe" is aimed at trainees as well as vocational students from commercial, medical, technical, social and IT professions who are undergoing an initial vocational training. Over a project duration of two years, 80 participants will be able to make a 4-8-week vocational internship abroad in another European country. The participants are thus offered a way to gain first professional experience abroad, while at the same time acquiring intercultural competence and professional language skills.

The experience with previous mobility projects shows that there is a growing demand for mobility services. Vocational schools and training companies are expressing increased interest and demand to send young people abroad for an internship during their education. Arbeit und Leben NRW is taking on these tasks. It is part of the organisation’s European development plan to make young people “fir for work” in Europe. 

The participants complete an internship abroad in the countries of France, Ireland, Poland, Spain, Turkey and the United Kingdom. After an introductory and orientation program on site, they take part in language courses, followed by the vocational internship.

All participants complete an application and selection process at Arbeit und Leben NRW. They attend an extensive preparation in the form of seminars with descriptions of the learning objectives, carried out by Arbeit und Leben NRW. The company placements are made possible by partner organizations abroad, who will furthermore ensure a mentoring and monitoring as well as organisational processes on site. After returning, participants take part in a follow-up with Arbeit und Leben NRW.

With this project, the young participants experience a leap forward in development and a stronger personality. They develop a new perception on interculturality in everyday life, more tolerance and flexibility. Communicating in a foreign language will become clearer and more freely. They attain a higher degree of independence. With the certification of their learning outcomes by the Europass - Mobility Pass their employment opportunities are improved. 

The target group often has little or no experience abroad and only little opportunity to apply its usual low level of foreign language skills. In commercial, technical and social sectors, flexibility, mobility and strong personalities are increasingly required. It is expected that these characteristics are strengthened by completion of the mobility. In commercial professions as well as in IT professions, the European orientation is growing steadily. The competences acquired in the framework of this project increase employability on the domestic as well as on the European labor market.

In full-time vocational schools operational practice is often lacking, which can partly be offset by proDISCO.  Furthermore, in the long term, especially in the area of dual education, a contribution is to be made to improve the transparency and recognition of learning services.

The training companies and educational institutions involved are exchanging experiences on vocational training and the organization of vocational education and training and are therefore actively shaping their opening up to Europe. They recognize new potential among the trainees and in European cooperation. New coalitions regarding the structure and design of vocational training are taking place at the European level. 

For its part, Arbeit und Leben NRW opens up new issues and needs that young workers in Europe are concerned with. 

The mobility of educational staff will strenght the european dimension in the involved institutions. Trainees and apprentices can better support and promote the mobility of young people through their own international experience. Furthermore, the organization Arbeits und Leben NRW will continue its European strategy within the development of the local projects on an european scale.

Learnmark Horsens  has obtained good results by offering our students and staff study and carreer mobility abroad. We have a variety of educations for young people and want to offer an Erasmus grant for both our tecnical, business and collge students. Also for more mature students, who have apprenticeship contracts we want to offer placement in enterprises abroad. 

We end  a 2 year  Erasmus KA1 in 2018 - and due to the the very good experiences , and good feed back from all the participants, we are well prepared and ready to move on with a new Eramus KA 2 from 2018-2020. Our main intention is to provide Erasmus exchanges  with high quality and high outcome for the participants.  

In vocational education we apply for both EUX students and students in ordinary vocational education, basic course and main course.  In some of the educations we apply for a 2-week mobility - and in others for a 3-week mobility. We are aware that the impact will be higher in a 3 week mobility, but time is a problem on basic course, so here we apply for a 2-week mobility.  

Learnmark Horsens has a strategical focus to increase internationalization in all areas of education in our school. It's a highly prioritated effort in the future years, as we want more young students to experience a stay in another European country during their education. We consider it will have a high impact that students get more outlook and insight in education and culture in other countries. During their mobility they will develop important personal and social competencies, but they will also be challenged in professional skills and benefit from inspiration for future education and worklife.
For students and teachers it is a good opportunity to obtain insight and knowledge according to management, learning and professional competencies. The participating teachers will take part in the monitoring of the project and development of the organisation. 

To ensure high quality and implementation of the project we will focus on participants’ visible learning outcome. There must be clear goals and good feedback. All students, who are taking part in the mobility project will evaluate the mobility project and in cooperation with the partner school, we will assess all students' personal and professional development by using learning agreements, portfolio and EURO pass.  

The expected outcome for the students is mainly to increase the students' linguistic, international and intercultural competencies.  Particularly the VET students will benefit from the mobilty - as it can give them personal experiencies and open their perspective on international issues. We also expect they will obtain new  competencies, which will make them more qualified for internships or jobs - as well as open up the European and global perspective in many aspects of life. 

For students from HHX and HTX the theoretical part of learning will be more relevant when they get a more practical approach during their work placement. It will add a new dimension and qualify them for higher education and employment in the global labour market. We expect all students to become more innovative and intercultural, which will have a positive impact for the individual student - but also it might inspire to study abroad. All students will work in a company and get a good career experience , which is also a part of their career learning. 

In DK there is focus on talent development, so also here the international perspective is very relevant. 

The expected outcome for teachers, managers or other professionals is to achieve intercultural and linguistic skills. This will support the international strategy and internationalisation at Learnmark Horsens. Another expected outcome is that the mobility will provide new skills and competencies as well professional and personal. They will be inspired and able to integrate new pedagogical methods and tools. Managers will also get new inspiration according to management and internationalisation. 
The whole project and results will be evaluated and dissiminated according to the application and the results will be discussed in relevant internal fora - in school departments, teams and at management meetings.  In general we will discuss with partners, VET institutions and international network. 
We will of course monitor the outcome via facebook, press and other relevant media.
Estágios de turismo em Belfast Golf Hotels

Escola Profissional de Alte (EPA) is very proud to embrace an international mobility project for 8 trainees and 2 trainers in the tourism area. Epalte is a vocational school established in 1992 and located in the most typical village of the Algarve (Portugal), in Alte, Loulé municipality and teaches professional courses, including tourism, trade and processing and food quality control, conferring the level IV of professional qualification,  and courses of education and training for  Distribution Traders in order to conclude the ninth grade. The school aims to create conditions to provide quality education to prepare its graduates to join the labor market successfully.
The participation in this mobility project, called BELFAST-GOLF-HOTELS-TRAINEESHIPS meets the guiding lines of the school educational project, it aims to provide its students key skills and welcoming techniques in golf hotels, the use of specific software, to foster cooperation and team work, multilingualism, creativity, innovation and entrepreneurship and provide important new work experiences to the “curriculum vitae” of participants and professional success.
Despite having courses that cover several areas, the highlight is on training in the tourism area, including welcoming and reception therefore some students, who already show some professional profile and good basic skills, such as responsibility, organization, socialization, some communication skills in the field of English, adaption to various contexts, were chosen. This work experience aims to have the opportunity of improving their skills and getting work experience in golf hotels located in Belfast through the intermediary company - Intern Europe.
We hope that the participation in this project will contribute to the acquisition and consolidation of our teachers' knowledge and to encourage our graduates to become entrepreneurs throughout their lives and to invest in their personal and professional future.
BELFAST-GOLF-HOTELS-TRAINEESHIPS is a small step for a big leap (“think locally, act globally”) to encourage our students living in the most disadvantaged areas to invest in the quality of their training, to promote the inclusion and multilingualism, in order to know other cultures, to acquire and improve their skills and to create social networks for sharing knowledge so that they are up to the demands and competitiveness of the labor market.
The school long-term expectation is to attract young people who are unsure and at risk of dropping out to believe and engage in professional courses that enable them important work experiences to become excellent professionals.
Wiltshire College European work experience for Travel & Tourism students

This project will be delivered over two years.  Over this period, we will recruit 35 travel & tourism students to undertake 4 week work placements in tourism focussed host organisations, based in Seville and Crete. Student will travel in groups of 10-15 and will be accompanied by staff, at a ratio of 1 staff:10 students. All participants will be students from our Level 3 BTEC travel and tourism diploma. The mobility will provide an opportunity to apply their theoretical classroom learning in a real life work setting. 

Our aim is to create an experience for the students that will enhance their overall programme of study. The project will support this by giving the students the opportunity to live and work in another country whereby they can adapt their social skills when dealing with a new culture and language. 

At present, we are able to offer work placements to students in the local area, but we recognise the value that an international dimension will bring. It will encourage learners to become more independent, develop their confidence, self assurance and other key skills in a structured and supportive setting.

For many of our learners, this will be their first experience of travel outside the UK or even their home community. In the context of their vocational course, travel & tourism, it is vital that they have some international experience, of working and communicating with people in a different language and culture. The mobility is a chance to offer learners this experience, in an environment of close staff and peer supervision and support. This will put them in a much stronger position to access employment in the sector, and equip them with a broader perspective of the opportunities available to them. 

The mobility will give our learners a broad understanding of different types of travel and tourism organisations within two popular tourist locations. 

We have support mechanisms in place to support our young learners through the accompanying person role, work placement supervisors, and local reps in each host location. We will also design in depth preparatory activities, and schedule parents evenings and info events prior to departure. 

We will agree a set of learning outcomes for each learner, which will be aligned to specific units of their vocational course. they will also have personal learning objectives. We will look for opportunities to integrate the mobility into our course delivery, for example, setting activities for students whilst on placement using our online software package, which will enable students to collaborate and  learn about both locations and the experiences of their peers, in addition to their own individual placement experience. 

We expect the impact will be that learners develop their confidence and self assurance, raise their aspirations and broaden their horizons. It will be a significant professional and personal development opportunity. In  the long term, we hope it will impact on their onward progression and career path decisions. 

It will be a development opportunity for the staff involved, to engage with new employers and forge new European partnerships.It will be an opportunity to enhance course delivery and integrate a mobility opportunity into the course, thus making the course more attractive to learners, which we hope in the short term will improve learner motivation and performance and in the longer term positively impact on marketing and recruitment for the College.
PROYECTO EUROPA "JULIAN SANZ DEL RÍO IV"

This project aims to exponentially improve the employability of the participants, contributing directly to the development of a professional experience in the specific academic field of the participant, as well as to the acquisition of a series of transversal cultural, social, and linguistic competences that will help the participants to integrate in the labor market and in a more just and sustainable society. Likewise, this experience will bring to Soria the new knowledge acquired by young people, which will result in new opportunities for improvement for the city and for local companies that hire one of these participants. By contributing to the Europeanization of the city and the modernization of businesses, many young people will not see the need to abandon it and will make this city the ideal place to live and work and / or develop their future business projects.

Soria has been working for years to provide to this group of a quality professional training abroad, so that they not only acquire solid knowledge and strong demand in the market, but also to strengthen the language skills and entrepreneurship of the destination country and to allow them to grow on a personal level beyond our borders.

The City Council has convened educational centers members of the Consortium to launch PROJECT EUROPE "JULIÁN SANZ DEL RÍO IV". To this end, the created consortium will again offer to 25 Sorians, between 17 and 35 years old, who are undertaking a cycle of VET level in one of the Educational Institutions that are part of said Consortium, the possibility of making a 90 days long-training ErasmusPro in a company in an EU country. The internships will be part or not of the FCT (according to the center), distributing 15 scholarships for FCT and 10 scholarships for practices without FCT. The students who at the time of the internships are recent graduates must complete the mobility within the year following graduation. In addition, the project will have the online preparatory tool (OLS). The stays are organised in two flows and are scheduled from March and until June 2019 for the first flow and between September and December 2019 for the second flow.

The Educational Institutions that are part of this Consortium are:
• Soria City Council 
• Soria School of Art and Design Superior 
• CIFP La Merced
• CIFP Pico Fronts
• IES Virgen del Espino
• IES Castilla
• IES Polytechnic of Soria
• IES Antonio Machado

The project will have the support of international organisations which will help in the monitoring and management of the training in each one of the countries involved in the project: United Kingdom (Belfast), Ireland (Cork), Italy (Florence), Austria (Vienna) and Portugal (Lisbon).

The main activities scheduled are:
- Publicity campaign for the project.
- Receiving of applications.
- Process of selection of candidates.
- Preparatory meetings, linguistic and work training before departure.
- In March and September 2019: Period of training stays. The duration will be three months.
- Upon the return of participants, a welcome reception will be organised.
- Analysis of the evaluations of the program and work orientation course for the participants.
- Delivery of the final report.

The members of the consortium will work together. They will maintain phone and email contact  and will arrange regular meetings in order to evaluate the course of the project, providing solutions to possible problems and be able to apply corrective actions when necessary.

The coordinator, the sending and receiving organisations will work together in producing the training curricula adapted to each participant. Once selected, the participants will be able to do an online contacts with tutors at receiving organisations, normally via Skype. The intermediary and receiving organisations will monitor and evaluate the participants and will ensure the compliance with all of the established agreements. There will be constant contact between the international organisations and the coordinator of the project. The evaluation of the stays will include the questionnaires sent to the participants by email, the evaluations of the participants on the part of the international organisations, as well as the intern’s evaluations of the participating organisations.

The expected impact on the participants is related to the improvement in ICTs and linguistic knowledge, better professionalism, better social skills and cultural knowledge, etc. Additionally, in the participating organisations the impact will be positive due to the enrichment which it provides to work with European organisations, being able to learn new methods from them which they will be able to apply to their own organisations. 

Some of the long-term benefits will be: greater quality of the education system, development of the entrepreneurial culture, innovation in the different sectors, development of new technologies, increase in the awareness of European citizenship, etc.
Lelewel dla zawodowców - międzynarodowe staże zawodowe - edycja II

The main aim of Lelewel for professional - international internships - edition II projects is increase professional competences of 48 students ZSZ nr 6 im. J. Lelewela in Ponzań through participation in foreign internships.

Specific objectives:
- foregin interships of 48 students,
- development of professional competences,
- gaining work experience in a foreign company,
- increase of competitiveness on the labor market,
- ability to work in a multicultural and multilingual team,
- increased motivation to take on new challenges,
- increase in intercultural awareness, tolerance,
- increase of motivation to learn foreign languages,
- raising the level of language, in particular as regards spoken language,
- increasing the chances of work and opening up to new opportunities after the end of the project (e.g. foreign studies).

To participate in the project will be selected 48 students in competitions in advertisment technician, digital techniques of graphic processes, logistics techniques, graphics and digital printing technician, photography and multimedia technician attend to III class.
Apart from the obvious benefits for the students expect that through the project will expand the image of institutions in the region, the country and the international market. Through the implementation of project activities on foreign placements of our students in Italy and Great Britain, will be included in the revised European School Development Plan areas ie. The European dimension of the organization, intercultural awareness, and mobility and language skills, in particular real (native) use language.

Participation in the project will be so for the participants prepared a valuable part of the process to work in the profession learned. First, it would gain the necessary experience, and second, to help them open up to Europe and prepare for the use of the opportunities offered by the European integration process.
The main outcome of the school will be the experience gained in the implementation of foreign practices that contribute to the development of international cooperation in the establishment and courageous action by the school authorities with new challenges in this regard. As a result, we hope that in the future we will be able to offer our students, or new candidates, not just school internships, whether local companies, but also abroad. Certainly such a varied and wide range of education, which is further strengthen promotional activities, positive impact on the image of the school. We will be more attractive and competitive educational market, which in turn will help to attract more candidates among middle school students.

The project participants will take their professional practice in companies and organizations in Italy (Forli) and in Great Britain (Belfast).
After the completion of the project will be prepared a booklet containing good practice placements and suggestions related to the
gap of jurisdiction for students of technical and vocational schools. On the basis of materials collected by the students will be prepared and partner promotional video. It will be a material incentive to read the results of the project. With its accessible form, and the inclusion of interviews with project participants will show the realities of international practices and will encourage further potential project participants to engage in this kind of initiative.
Zawodowcy w Europie - Zagraniczne praktyki szansą na rozwój osobisty i zawodowy uczniów

The main aim of project „Professionals in Europe - Foreign work practices as an opportunity for personal and professional development of students” is development of competences and gaining professional experience by students of the CKZiU in Ludów Polskie through the implementation of foreign practices. The project will last two years. The internships will take place with 3 partners: Germany, Italy and Great Britain. 3 partners will provide wide choice of internships. The project is aimed at increasing the attractiveness and efficiency of vocational education. Improving and making the education and vocational training systems more attractive by implementing it in another country, increasing employment opportunities, learning new, innovative methods and content of vocational training, developing skills in the organization of work, better adaptation to technological, environmental and social changes.

36 students of II and III grades (hotel industry technician, nutrition and catering services technician, advertising technician and agriculture technician) will be participants of the this project. We assume that approximately 60% will be students with fewer opportunities. Most of our students come from smaller towns and villages. They are people exposed to social exclusion. They have difficult access to well-paid jobs, culture and entertainment.

Project goals:
1. Development of hard skills.
Hard skills are necessary for the future profession of our students. We want our students to finish their education with knowledge and skills in a given direction. We are particularly interested in developing and acquiring new professional competences as well as improving language skills.
2. Development of soft skills.
Soft skills that we want to be developed during the project: ability to work in a team (also in an international team), resistance to stress, communication skills, independence and flexibility.
3. Increasing the competitiveness of students in the labor market.
4. Increasing level of intercultural awareness and tolerance.
5. Diverse internships.
6. Improving the quality and effectiveness of education.
7. Beginning of international cooperation.
8. Development of the European dimension of education.

We would like to our graduates will be:
- open to the world,
- tolerant,
- well-educated with broad professional competences,
- they showed an active attitude towards the world (they were not afraid to undertake new professional and life challenges).

The project will contribute to accomplishment identified school needs and fulfilling the European School Development Plan.

Project „Staż na 5"aims at improvement of the practical vocational education of its students and increase their employment  chances on the labour market through the development of cooperation skills as well as skills of behaving on international labour market together with the upgrade of their professional education level. 

On the school level the Project aims at strengthening of the service quality of the school and adjustment of education effects to the  
needs f the European labour market. 

The detailed aims of the project are:
a) increase of lanaguage skills (English, foreign client service, work in international team) 
b) increase of intercultural competences (including team work and business relations) 
c) increase of independence and self-service (openess to new environment, planning own budget)  
d) colleting professional experience (under the given profession) 
e) development of enterpreneurial and creative approaches  (including getting to know local service markets) 

To do so, 20 students acompanied by 2 teachers of  Complex of Schools no 5 in Stargard will participate in internships abroad along with preparations and evaluation of the process of participation. 

The interns will take part in internships in following professions:
- technician of food technology - 10 students (November 2018, Italy)
- car mechanics ervices - 10 students  (November 2018, GB)


All of the participants will participate also in the whole cycle of preparation, based on proven methodology. It includes language crush – course, cultural, pedagogical preparation and evaluation workshop of personal development. Each of the participants will receive a certificate from the hosting company, Europass Mobility and Europass - Language Passport.
At the end of the project a conference, in March 2019, a Picnic entitles "Course on 5"  informing about project experiences and results has been scheduled. The event will involve local authorities, companies and students of local gimnasiums.
The project is based on the close cooperation between partners based on tools and documents prepared during previous projects as Ovpelo, EuPQuA I,II,III, iMove and improvement of the methodology during the project in the aim of achieving the highest possible quality of action.
Education is a choice - exchange experiences 5

"Education is a choice - exchange experiences 5" is an educational mobility project addressed at students of Zespół Szkół nr 1 in Wieluń. Within the project framework, internships will be undertaken by 67 students of our school, learning to work in the following professions: gastronomic services specialist, logistics specialist, landscape architect, finance and banking technician, building technician, building technician - real estate management, land survey technician and economist. The participants will spend 4 weeks in Italy, Spain, Germany, Portugal, Northern Ireland or Malta.
The project constitutes an answer to high requirements faced by people looking for jobs, as well as to the reality of our local labour market, which may prove too small to provide jobs for all students educated in Wieluń. This is why the project aims at increasing professional qualifications of our students and preparing them for professional mobility they might need to exhibit in the future. The project will also allow them to gain or improve skills related to foreign languages, communicativeness and teamwork. Participation in the project is meant to have an impact on further professional development of students by motivating them to continuous education and imbuing them with active approach to managing their own development.
The project provides for a preparatory phase before the actual internships take place. It will consist of cultural and linguistic training courses that will help students benefit as much as possible from their participation in the project. A separate element of this phase will be a pedagogical preparation which is designed to help choose appropriate internship placement for each participant. Upon students' return we will conduct evaluation of the project and disseminate its results. The correct execution of the project and realization of its goals will be ensured through well-designed management process and communication with partners.
GoEurope - wir bringen Berliner in Bewegung: Mobilität für Auszubildende, Berufsschüler, Absolventen der beruflichen Bildung, Referendare und Berufsbildungsverantwortliche

The Charta will be put into practis as planned (see attachment), there will be two alterations two years after the initial application:

Organisation and staff:
The work group „Arbeitsbereich GoEurope“ is being strengthened with further staff members (4 Mobility managers in part time) and has the sole responsibility for mobility for learners and student teachers (see attached organigram). In addition, Ms. Radike-Thiel (38-% position) focusses on mobility for teachers and will be supported administratively by Arbeitsbereich GoEurope. The Arbeitsbereich GoEurope is being considerably strengthened by the described reorganization of the EU activities of the department for vocational training of SenBJF to enable reaching the ambitious goals of the Charta.
The Co-Directors of the Arbeitsbereich GoEurope have divided up the functions to be performed as follows:
Mr. Naumann: Charta, Strategy, Application for Erasmus, Quality Management, Controlling, personnel
Mr. Schuppan: GoEurope-Network, international cooperations, finances, budget, personnel, social media 

Network
The GoEurope-Network was considerably enlargened
The mobility network Xarxa is integrated into this application. Xarxa plans 20 mobilities IN and Out (Ms Ruebsam) per year.
The formal founding of the GoEurope-Network is in preparation (Mr. Schuppan)

Quality
We passed a NA Audit with good results (Mr. Naumann/Mr. Schuppan). All questions/demands posed afterwards could be answered/taken care of (workflow documentation). Our applied QM system and our applied workflow are the foundations of the current certification process. (Mr. Naumann)

Quantity
In the ongoing 2016 project more than 1.3 million euros and 829 participants will ensure that between 98% and 201% of the grants for high-quality mobilities (provable through QM-system) will be used.
For years we have a considerable number of underage participants, a growing number. Therefore the number of applied for accompaniments.

VET-Plong
For years we have been offering Berlin apprentices mobilities for durations of 3, 4, 6 and sometimes 12 months, and will continue to do so. We have a particular focus on vocations in the social health field (20 weekers).

Special events:
On June 12, 2018 we will celebrate „10 years GoEurope with 300 GoEurope participants (Europass ceremony), 30 headmasters and 20 representatives of the Berlin commercial world as well as the mayor of Berlin, Mr. Michael Müller will attend at the City Hall (Rotes Rathaus, see attachment)

Accompaniments:
For years we have a considerable number of underage participants, a growing number. Therefore the number of applied for accompaniments. We will facilitate mobilities for the vocational schools with students with special needs, therefore our demand for longer accompaniments will go up considerably for participants with physical inhibitions, special needs and learners with learning difficulties.

Trainers to Germany: 
Two Italian cooks that function as trainers and master cooks, will teach for 14 days each at the Berliner gastronomy school.

Additional Topics for staff mobility: QM, SQL, autonomous schools, inclusion, school absentism, non-violent communication, methods employed in language classe, entrepreneurship, digitalization

New target groups:
BAM (Berliner Ausbildungsmodell): BAM is a new vocational training model in Berlin, it is a one-year training course designed according to the dual training system with the goal that participants are taken on as trainees by a company during this year, at the very latest by the end of the one-year program. The first year of training will be credited towards completing a 3-year training program.

New learning formats:
Entrepreneur program: apprentices from more than three European countries develop a marketing-mix for their own product ideas in teams. They are supported pedagogically and content-wise by local vocational training experts and marketing experts. They will present their results in simulated investor presentations. (a competition and prizes to be awarded).
The preparation of the participants from the Elinor-Ostrom-Schule in Berlin will be done during a subject called WiSo (20 units Marketing Mix) in English, the curriculum was amended accordingly. The participants will present their results additionally in Berlin and will be graded. The work phase encompasses hospitations in startups in London or Dublin. The participants have to pass a multi-level application process.

Brexit:
To be prepared for Brexit effects we have undertaken numerous business trips in the past year. We have enhanced our partner network with a number of further partners in Ireland, Malta and companies in northern Italy where English in spoken. This way flows to UK could be redirected with problems. Our partner in London has already founded a subsidiary in Dublin, first pilot flows planned for May.

The project " MOVIEing through art into the future" is a partnership encompassing 6 countries: Germany, Italy, Turkey, Portugal, United Kingdom and Martinique. The 537 students involved in this project  are between 11 and 17 years old.
In order to propagate the media educational work in different areas, film scripts will be worked out and realised in all partner countries. Thus, small movies will be created that introduce regions, cultural institutions and local architecture. The participants will learn how to plan movie projects, to deal with the digital film technology, the editing and sound rendering as well as the public representation. A side effect is the active use and immersion in the English language. There is much room for creative ideas, the participants will learn a lot about institutions and cultural features in their own regions and are given the possibility to compare their region and work with those of their partners.  Participants will recognise connecting similarities and receive impulses to optimize their own organisation and projects. Furthermore the participants will learn about new occupational fields that normally are outside their daily experiences. The results of their short films which encompass the following titles “The beauty of my territory”, “Leisure time places, culture and own region facilities”, “Art and outstanding  architecture in my area”,will be released via internet where everybody who is interested may watch them. In order to increase cooperation between students and teachers a common short movie is going to be created along the 3 years project with the title  "The ideal European school" focusing on the best practice and activities wich students have acquired and performed during project visits , as well as exchange of ppt presentations and through project visits or the dissemination of reports.
We aim to:
Increase students' motivation towards school and learning.
Increase ability to  team work both  in teachers and in students.
Improve knowledge of local  history, geography art  and music.
Improve knowledge of  the same subjects related to  the other European  partner countries.
Present and compare our respective territories and lifestyles to other European countries.
Strengthen cooperation and links with our respective local institutions (town council, libraries,  local heritage and cultural associations  and students’ families.
Encourage the increase of the local institution investments in alternative teaching methods and activitiees.
